struct.name: kld_matrix
struct.doc:
A Somewhat Non Standard Implementation of a matrix
The current design of this matrix is to use two collections of kld_vector_t, one to represent all the rows inside of the kld_matrix_t and another to represent all the colums. This effectively doubles the memory footprint of a kld_matrix_t, requiring 2 bytes for each entry. However, due to the underlying implementation of a kld_vector_t, we can now garuntee constant time operations for retrieving single elements inside of the kld_matrix_t as well as entire rows and columns.
